text: Surface runoff is the excess water that flows over land when the soil below it is flooded. This is a big part of the water cycle.Robert E. Horton, The Horton Papers (1933)Keith Beven, Robert E. Horton's perceptual model of infiltration processes, Hydrological Processes, Wiley Intersciences DOI 10:1002 hyp 5740 (2004) This a prime cause for soil erosion and degradation of soil. ==References== Category:Drainage
title: Surface runoff
